thoughts.text: The lynx command is not installed on the system. I can use the curl command to download the HTML source code of the Google search results page, and then use grep to extract the URLs of the search results.
thoughts.reasoning: The lynx command is not installed on the system, so I need to use a different command to browse the web in a non-graphical interface. The curl command can be used to download the HTML source code of a webpage, and then grep can be used to extract the URLs of the search results.
thoughts.plan:
- Use the curl command to download the HTML source code of the Google search results page.
- Use grep to extract the URLs of the search results.
- Save the URLs to a file.
thoughts.speak: I will now try to search for resources on martial arts using the curl command. I will use the search engine Google.
